growing.soil: Well-draining, slightly acidic; hilltop or slope ideal

planting.whenToPlant: Plant bare-root trees in early spring in a low wind area
companion: Other plum varieties for improved pollination and yield

pruning: Prune during dormancy (similar to other fruit trees like apple and peach)
Remove weak, diseased, or damaged branches
Thin out crowded or crossing branches to improve airflow and structure
careAndMaintenance.thinning: Thin fruits to leave 2-4 inches between plums on the branch

harvestingAndUsage.whenToHarvest: When fully colored and slightly soft to the touch
harvestingAndUsage.howToHarvest: Gently twist and pull to detach from the branch
harvestingAndUsage.notes: Plum trees typically decline in productivity after 15-20 years

pollinators: Some varieties are self-fertile but most benefit from nearby plum varieties
